23namespace sh
24{
25
26struct TSourceLoc
27{
28 int first_file;
29 int first_line;
30 int last_file;
31 int last_line;
32};
33
34constexpr TSourceLoc kNoSourceLoc{-1, -1, -1, -1};
35
36//
37// Put POOL_ALLOCATOR_NEW_DELETE in base classes to make them use this scheme.
38//
39#define POOL_ALLOCATOR_NEW_DELETE \
40 void *operator new(size_t s) { return GetGlobalPoolAllocator()->allocate(s); } \
41 void *operator new(size_t, void *_Where) { return (_Where); } \
42 void operator delete(void *) {} \
43 void operator delete(void *, void *) {} \
44 void *operator new[](size_t s) { return GetGlobalPoolAllocator()->allocate(s); } \
45 void *operator new[](size_t, void *_Where) { return (_Where); } \
46 void operator delete[](void *) {} \
47 void operator delete[](void *, void *) {}
48
49//
50// Pool version of string.
51//
52typedef pool_allocator<char> TStringAllocator;
53typedef std::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, TStringAllocator> TString;
54typedef std::basic_ostringstream<char, std::char_traits<char>, TStringAllocator> TStringStream;
55
56//
57// Persistent string memory. Should only be used for strings that survive
58// across compiles.
59//
60#define TPersistString std::string
61#define TPersistStringStream std::ostringstream
62
63//
64// Pool allocator versions of vectors, lists, and maps
65//
66template <class T>
67class TVector : public std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T>>
68{
69 public:
70 POOL_ALLOCATOR_NEW_DELETE
71
72 typedef typename std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T>>::size_type size_type;
73 TVector() : std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T>>() {}
74 TVector(const pool_allocator<T> &a) : std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T>>(a) {}
75 TVector(size_type i) : std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T>>(i) {}
76 TVector(size_type i, const T &value) : std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T>>(i, value) {}
77 template <typename InputIt>
78 TVector(InputIt first, InputIt last) : std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T>>(first, last)
79 {}
80 TVector(std::initializer_list<T> init) : std::vector<T, pool_allocator<T>>(init) {}
81};
82
83template <class K, class D, class H = std::hash<K>, class CMP = std::equal_to<K>>
84class TUnorderedMap : public std::unordered_map<K, D, H, CMP, pool_allocator<std::pair<const K, D>>>
85{
86 public:
87 POOL_ALLOCATOR_NEW_DELETE
88 typedef pool_allocator<std::pair<const K, D>> tAllocator;
89
90 TUnorderedMap() : std::unordered_map<K, D, H, CMP, tAllocator>() {}
91 // use correct two-stage name lookup supported in gcc 3.4 and above
92 TUnorderedMap(const tAllocator &a)
93 : std::unordered_map<K, D, H, CMP, tAllocator>(
94 std::unordered_map<K, D, H, CMP, tAllocator>::key_compare(),
95 a)
96 {}
97};
98
99template <class K, class D, class CMP = std::less<K>>
100class TMap : public std::map<K, D, CMP, pool_allocator<std::pair<const K, D>>>
101{
102 public:
103 POOL_ALLOCATOR_NEW_DELETE
104 typedef pool_allocator<std::pair<const K, D>> tAllocator;
105
106 TMap() : std::map<K, D, CMP, tAllocator>() {}
107 // use correct two-stage name lookup supported in gcc 3.4 and above
108 TMap(const tAllocator &a)
109 : std::map<K, D, CMP, tAllocator>(std::map<K, D, CMP, tAllocator>::key_compare(), a)
110 {}
111};
112
113// Basic implementation of C++20's span for use with pool-allocated containers (TVector) or static
114// arrays. This is used by the array sizes member of TType to allow arrayed types to be
115// constexpr-constructed.
116// See the reference for std::span here: https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/container/span
117template <typename T>
118class TSpan
119{
120 public:
121 typedef size_t size_type;
122
123 constexpr TSpan() {}
124 constexpr TSpan(T *ptr, size_type size) : mData(ptr), mSize(size) {}
125
126 constexpr TSpan(const TSpan &that) : mData(that.mData), mSize(that.mSize) {}
127 constexpr TSpan &operator=(const TSpan &that)
128 {
129 mData = that.mData;
130 mSize = that.mSize;
131 return *this;
132 }
133
134 // Note: the pointer is taken out of the TVector because TVector's memory is pool allocated,
135 // so the memory will live on even if the TVector is destroyed.
136 template <typename S>
137 TSpan(const TVector<S> &vec) : mData(vec.data()), mSize(vec.size())
138 {}
139 template <typename S>
140 TSpan &operator=(const TVector<S> &vec)
141 {
142 mData = vec.data();
143 mSize = vec.size();
144 return *this;
145 }
146
147 constexpr bool operator==(const TSpan &that) const
148 {
149 if (mSize != that.mSize)
150 {
151 return false;
152 }
153
154 if (mData == that.mData)
155 {
156 return true;
157 }
158
159 for (size_type index = 0; index < mSize; ++index)
160 {
161 if (mData[index] != that.mData[index])
162 {
163 return false;
164 }
165 }
166
167 return true;
168 }
169 constexpr bool operator!=(const TSpan &that) const { return !(*this == that); }
170
171 constexpr T *data() const { return mData; }
172 constexpr size_type size() const { return mSize; }
173 constexpr bool empty() const { return mSize == 0; }
174
175 constexpr T &operator[](size_type index) const { return mData[index]; }
176 constexpr T &front() const { return mData[0]; }
177 constexpr T &back() const { return mData[mSize - 1]; }
178
179 constexpr T *begin() const { return mData; }
180 constexpr T *end() const { return mData + mSize; }
181
182 constexpr std::reverse_iterator<T *> rbegin() const
183 {
184 return std::make_reverse_iterator(end());
185 }
186 constexpr std::reverse_iterator<T *> rend() const
187 {
188 return std::make_reverse_iterator(begin());
189 }
190
191 constexpr TSpan first(size_type count) const
192 {
193 ASSERT(count <= mSize);
194 return count == 0 ? TSpan() : TSpan(mData, count);
195 }
196 constexpr TSpan last(size_type count) const
197 {
198 ASSERT(count <= mSize);
199 return count == 0 ? TSpan() : TSpan(mData + mSize - count, count);
200 }
201 constexpr TSpan subspan(size_type offset, size_type count) const
202 {
203 ASSERT(offset + count <= mSize);
204 return count == 0 ? TSpan() : TSpan(mData + offset, count);
205 }
206
207 private:
208 T *mData = nullptr;
209 size_t mSize = 0;
210};
211
212// Integer to TString conversion
213template <typename T>
214inline TString str(T i)
215{
216 ASSERT(std::numeric_limits<T>::is_integer);
217 char buffer[((8 * sizeof(T)) / 3) + 3];
218 const char *formatStr = std::numeric_limits<T>::is_signed ? "%d" : "%u";
219 snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), formatStr, i);
220 return buffer;
221}
222
223// Allocate a char array in the global memory pool. str must be a null terminated string. strLength
224// is the length without the null terminator.
225inline const char *AllocatePoolCharArray(const char *str, size_t strLength)
226{
227 size_t requiredSize = strLength + 1;
228 char *buffer = static_cast<char *>(GetGlobalPoolAllocator()->allocate(requiredSize));
229 memcpy(buffer, str, requiredSize);
230 ASSERT(buffer[strLength] == '\0');
231 return buffer;
232}
233
234// Initialize a new stream which must be imbued with the classic locale
235template <typename T>
236T InitializeStream()
237{
238 T stream;
239 stream.imbue(std::locale::classic());
240 return stream;
241}
242
243} // namespace sh
244
245namespace std
246{
247template <>
248struct hash<sh::TString>
249{
250 size_t operator()(const sh::TString &s) const
251 {
252 return angle::PMurHash32(0, s.data(), static_cast<int>(s.length()));
253 }
254};
255} // namespace std
256
257#endif // COMPILER_TRANSLATOR_COMMON_H_
